verbose_text: Evidence suggests that the soluble inositol phosphates, such as inositol (1,3,4,5,6) P 5 and InsP 6 (inositol hexakisphosphate), which are present at micromolar levels serve to anchor a portion of cellular PDK1 in the cytosol as they interact with the PH domain of PDK1 at nanomolar affinities, thereby preventing PDK1 from interacting with 3-phosphoinositides at the membrane [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: inositol phosphates, such as inositol(1,3,4,5,6)P 5  and InsP 6  (inositol hexakisphosphate), which are present at micromolar levels serve to anchor a portion of cellular PDK1 in the cytosol as they interact with the PH domain of PDK1 at nanomolar affinities, thereby preventing PDK1
